required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Role of Physician Gestalt in Predicting COVID-19 in Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Study to Determine the Role of Physician Gestalt in Clinical Prediction of COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Jubilee Mission Medical College and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Jubilee Mission Medical College and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: THIS IS A PROSPECTIVE OBSERVATIONAL STUDY TO DETERMINE THE ROLE OF PHYSICIAN GESTALT IN CLINICAL PREDICTION OF COVID 19.

detailed_description.textblock: Among patients attending the Emergency Department, prompt identification of possible cases of COVID 19 is important to avoid the spread. An immediate clinical diagnosis is important for point of care decision making on choice of treatment facility as well as for triaging, testing and to quarantine patients admitted to the hospital from emergency room. Hence this study attempts to find out the role of physician gestalt in early diagnosis and differentiation of COVID 19.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative likelihood ratio of physician gestalt in diagnosis of COVID 19 in patients presenting to ED who are being sent for COVID 19 specific testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative likelihood ratio of clinical and epidemiological variables in patients presenting to ED who are being sent for COVID 19 specific testing.

clinical_study.condition: All Patients Undergoing COVID 19 Specific Testing

study_pop.textblock: All patients presenting to ED, who undergo COVID 19 specific testing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients presenting to ED, who undergo COVID 19 specific testing.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with active COVID 19 disease diagnosed outside All brought dead cases. All patients not consenting to take part in the study.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Jubilee Mission Medical College and Research Institute

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form
